answers.answer: Sounds like you have been through a lot...I can't help but wonder, if your virus affected all of your other counts...I am new to this site, so am just speculating, I by no means know much about this Thyroid stuff...I'm just on my 6th. week of Levothryoxin. the dose was decreased 2 weeks ago, and I still fell like it is too much. However, I guess they are trying to shrink the goiter...hopefully I will know more at my next visit. I feel lost when I don't know what is ok and what is not...so I just muddle through.Take care of yourself.
I just looked at my lab sheet and it indicates that the normal range for TSH is 0.450-4.500 This is in Oregon, and I've been told that each lab does it differently...

TSH is a pituitary hormone, and doesn't paint the full thyroid picture. For example, I have Hashimoto's thyroid disease. My TSH never went above 2.74. It is now a 0.04 thanks to my thyroid hormone. My endo is not concerned about my TSH. He treats my symptoms and my FreeT4 and FreeT3. Frees are active thyroid hormone.:) Tamra

Dottie, many thyroid sufferers have more than one auto-immunity, example: thyroid disease and diabetes or Sjrogen's. I suggest monitoring your glucose.Also, there is a lot of research on auto-immune disease and triggers such as yeast, antibiotics, gluten, etc....When I have to go on antibiotics, I eat yogurt to balance out the enzymes. I have eliminated gluten from my diet and am feeling much better. Everyone is different but maybe looking into your dietary habits and cutting something each week to see if you feel better. Soy, dairy, gluten, wheat, sugar, high fructose corn syrup...Here's an excellent website on Leaky Gut Syndrome and its association with auto-immune diseases, as well as triggers. http://www.leakygut.co.uk/index.htmFinally, I suggest going to the doc who put you on Armour and asking for a FreeT3 and FreeT4 test. You may need to have your dosage adjusted.:) Tamra

question: Was put on Armour thyroid - years ago - wince it is not so easy to obtain was recently put on Porpine - (I think of porcupine when I see the name).  I noticed today in my lab results for my blood thinner - that my TSH was 0,083 - I also see that my glucose was 121 - I was recently in the hospital with double pneumonia, 103.8 fever  and p/e- on heparin and drip anti-biotics - my usual 100 glucose shot to 177 - then back down, in one day.  Wondering if all of this could have affected my system.
title: TSH  0.083  Good Or Bad Or OK ??
